BRN00129:
PATIENT: [REDACTED]   MRN: [REDACTED]   DOB: [REDACTED]
DATE: [REDACTED]   LOCATION: Hybrid bronchoscopy suite
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopic lung volume reduction with endobronchial valve placement, left upper lobe
INDICATION: 73-year-old male with heterogeneous emphysema and hyperinflation, dyspnea despite maximal medical therapy; prior Chartis assessment negative for collateral ventilation in the left upper lobe.

ANESTHESIA / AIRWAY:
General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation.

PROCEDURE SUMMARY:
Flexible bronchoscope advanced via ETT. Left upper lobe anatomy inspected; no endobronchial lesions. Three Zephyr valves were placed in the LUL segmental bronchi using standard delivery catheters (apicoposterior, anterior, and lingular segments). Chartis data from a prior session confirmed absent collateral ventilation, so repeat balloon occlusion was not performed.

No biopsies, BAL, navigation, or EBUS were performed.

Post-placement inspection showed good valve position with complete occlusion of treated segments and no evidence of migration.

COMPLICATIONS:
None intra-procedure. Immediate post-procedure chest radiograph without pneumothorax.

PLAN:
Admit to monitored bed. Daily chest radiographs for 72 hours. Outpatient follow-up in 6 weeks with spirometry.
